description: Implement the Configuration of Typescript Correctly

comments.comment: Turn on EVERYTHING in tsconfig. When something yells at you decide for yourself whether it’s valuable or not. Turn things off as you go. Leave most on
You could try another tools to start a project, next time instead start with vite and tell us how you felt.
I also highly recommend using Vite, or really ANYTHING other than Webpack.
Webpack makes working with typescript a pain in the ass, and imho it hasn’t really gotten much better even after 4 major version updates.
Use Deno and avoid the tsconfig and webpack hassles

description: Migrate Project From Webpack to Vite!

comments.comment: Webpack is written in JavaScript, whilst Vite uses esbuild which is written in Go, making it way much faster.
Correct. Saying "Vite uses esbuild" doesn't answer anything. Esbuild is faster because it uses a compiled (and faster) language.
I don't know why anyone would use Webpack over Vite. The difference is night and day...
I agree. You can get started here: https://vitejs.dev

description: Weekly Design Critique: Magiclean Mobile App
Sending Message Illustration for Mindtree App

comments.comment: Definitely avoid re-implementing standard data structures, since the Rust ones are very good
Rust already have such basic classes like String stabilized thus there are no need for that phase in it's evolution.
Rust does not have a stable ABI, so if you want to share precompiled Rust code, you have to expose a C-style ABI.
Ah I see. So if I wanted to share a dll I would have to compile it in C and then create Rust bindings for it and include it as a crate then?
Exposing C ABI in Rust means to use #[repr(C)] on types with public content and extern C on functions.
Thanks for the knowledge, I appreciate it very much.
